subject: Photography
title: Filling the Frame
description: A 60-second lesson on Filling the Frame.

hook.text: Most beginners stand too far away. The subject is small, lost in empty space. Get closer.

buildup.text: Filling the frame means letting your subject dominate the image. Less empty space, more impact.

discovery.text: Robert Capa said: 'If your pictures aren't good enough, you're not close enough.' It's still true.

twist.text: Filling the frame doesn't mean zooming in. Sometimes it means getting closer â€” changing the relationship entirely.

climax.text: A face filling the entire frame conveys intimacy. A tiny subject in vast space conveys isolation. Both are valid.

punchline.text: When in doubt, take two steps forward.

quiz.question: What does 'filling the frame' mean in composition?
options: Letting the subject dominate the image with less empty space
Including as many objects as possible
